summary:
New South Wales (NSW) is a state in eastern Australia. It is bordered by other states and seas, with Sydney as its capital and most populated city. NSW has over 8.3 million residents, making it Australia's most populous state. Most people live in the Sydney area.

Established in 1788 as a British penal colony, NSW originally covered more than half of Australia. Over time, parts became separate colonies and states. Some island territories, like Lord Howe Island, remain part of NSW, while others are now federal territories.
title: New South Wales
